stPageCache Class Referenceabstract

#include <stPageCache.h>

Detailed Description

This class defines the basic interface for all page caches used by page manager implementations.

A cache is not suposed to destroy, create, read or write pages because it acts as an associative memory only. In other words, the hard work must be performed by the page manager.

Description of the usage is missing!!!

Warning
This class will replace CNSCache in future versions of this library.

Member Function Documentation

virtual stPage* stPageCache::Add ( stPage *  page,
bool &  modified 
)
pure virtual

Adds a new page into the cache. It may return the instance of the page that must be removed from the cache.

virtual stPage* stPageCache::Get ( stPageID  pageID)
pure virtual

Returns a page with a given page id.

Parameters
pageIDThe given page id.
Returns
The desired page or NULL it the page could not be found.
Warning
Due to optimization reasons, the returned instance will not be removed from the cache. Be aware of that.
virtual stPage* stPageCache::Pop ( bool &  modified)
pure virtual

Removes a page from the cache. This method must be used by page managers to flush all pages in the cache before its destruction.

Return values
Aflag that tells if the returned page was modified since it was read for the first time.
Returns
A page instance or null if this cache is empty.
Warning
The order of the pages are undetermined.
virtual void stPageCache::SetModified ( stPageID  pageID)
pure virtual

Notifies the cache that a given page was modified. If the page is not registered in the cache, this method does nothing.
